AI Description: ELPA (Eigenvalue SoLvers for Petaflop Applications) is a library for solving the standard and generalized eigenvalue problems for dense Hermitian matrices. It is designed for high-performance computing systems and utilizes highly scalable algorithms to achieve high efficiency.
Core Features: Solves Standard & Generalized Eigenvalue Problems For Dense Hermitian Matrices, Optimized For High-Performance Computing Systems, Utilizes Highly Scalable Algorithms For Efficiency, Suitable For Parallel Computing
General Tags: Linear Algebra, Eigenvalue Problems, High-Performance Computing, Scalable Algorithms
